Module com.boslott
Package com.boslott.DataAccess

Interface CustomerDAO

All Known Implementing Classes:
UCertdbCustomerDAO
public interface CustomerDAO
A CustomerDAO is a Data Access Object with all the methods needed to interact with Customer data
Author:
Steven Slott

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.Boolean deleteCustomer​(int ID)
    Deletes a Customer entry from the data source with the customerID ID
    java.util.ArrayList<Customer> findAllCustomers​(java.lang.Boolean refetch)
    Gets all Customer data from the data source.
    Customer findCustomer​(int id)
    Gets the data from the data source for one Customer with the customerID id
    Customer findCustomerByName​(java.lang.String name)
    Gets the data from the data source for one Customer with the customerName name
    java.lang.Boolean insertCustomer​(Customer newCustomer)
    Inserts a new Customer entry into the data source with data from the newCustomer object
    java.lang.Boolean isAllowedToDelete​(int IDToDelete)
    A Customer may not be deleted if there are Appointment entries related to the Customer.
    java.lang.Boolean updateCustomer​(Customer custToUpdate)
    Updates an existing Customer entry in the data source, updated with data from the custToUpdate object

  • Method Details

    • findAllCustomers

      java.util.ArrayList<Customer> findAllCustomers​(java.lang.Boolean refetch)
      Gets all Customer data from the data source. If the DAO chooses to cache the results locally, the refetch parameter can be used to signal to the method whether to return the cached data or to call to the data source again
      Parameters:
      refetch - if true, the method will call to the data source; if false, the method will return cached data
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of all Customer objects from the data source

    • findCustomer

      Customer findCustomer​(int id)
      Gets the data from the data source for one Customer with the customerID id
      Parameters:
      id - the customerID of the Customer to search the data source for
      Returns:
      a Customer object with the data for the Customer with customerID id

    • findCustomerByName

      Customer findCustomerByName​(java.lang.String name)
      Gets the data from the data source for one Customer with the customerName name
      Parameters:
      name - the customerName of the Customer to search the data source for
      Returns:
      the Customer object with the data for the Customer with customerName name

    • insertCustomer

      java.lang.Boolean insertCustomer​(Customer newCustomer)
      Inserts a new Customer entry into the data source with data from the newCustomer object
      Parameters:
      newCustomer - the object containing the property values for the new Customer entry
      Returns:
      true if the insertion successfully completes, false if the insertion does not successfully complete

    • updateCustomer

      java.lang.Boolean updateCustomer​(Customer custToUpdate)
      Updates an existing Customer entry in the data source, updated with data from the custToUpdate object
      Parameters:
      custToUpdate - the object containing the property values of the Customer entry to update, including the customerID of the Customer to update
      Returns:
      true if the update successfully completes, false if the update does not successfully completes

    • deleteCustomer

      java.lang.Boolean deleteCustomer​(int ID)
      Deletes a Customer entry from the data source with the customerID ID
      Parameters:
      ID - the customerID of the Customer entry to delete from the data source
      Returns:
      true if the deletion successfully completes, false if the deletion does not successfully complete

    • isAllowedToDelete

      java.lang.Boolean isAllowedToDelete​(int IDToDelete)
      A Customer may not be deleted if there are Appointment entries related to the Customer. This method is used to search the data source for the Customer with customerID IDToDelete and return whether or not a Customer may be deleted, in other words, whether the Customer entry has Appointments related to it or not
      Parameters:
      IDToDelete - the customerID of the Customer to search the data source for
      Returns:
      true if the Customer does not have any related Appointments, false if the Customer does have related Appointments
